p: FTIR analyses were employed to determine the interaction between the wall material (BKC and CMC) and the successful entrapment of the EOs in the microcapsules. The FTIR spectra of BKC, CMC, pure CGPO, microencapsulated CGPO, pure DEET, and microencapsulated DEET are shown in Figure 3. The absorption peaks of BKC ( Figure 3A) show the characteristic peaks at 3395 cm -1 because of N-H stretching ( 25), while the peaks at 2922 cm -1, 2853 cm -1 and 1456 cm -1 were due to the –CH stretching vibration of the surfactant tail and –CH bonding in the methyl and methylene groups, respectively ( 26).
